sub_topic: Identifying the perfect matching in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```
    A------B
    |\     | \
    | \    |  \
    |  \   |   \
    |   \  |    C
    |    \ |   / \
    |     \|  /   \
    D------E F-----G
```

What is the maximum number of perfect matchings possible in this graph?
message_2:
A perfect matching is a set of edges that covers all vertices such that each vertex is connected to exactly one other vertex in the set. In this graph, there are 7 vertices, which means we need to find a set of edges that connects all vertices in pairs.

We can find the maximum number of perfect matchings by analyzing the possible pairings:

1. A-E, B-C, D-F, G
2. A-E, B-G, C-F, D
3. A-D, B-C, E-F, G
4. A-D, B-G, E-C, F
5. A-B, D-E, F-G, C

There are 5 perfect matchings in this graph.
